title: Daily Note - 2025-06-27
summary: A significant day for the Collapsi game development, focusing on correcting a fundamental misunderstanding of game rules, implementing proper DFS pathfinding, and polishing the UI with new themes. This led to a more strategic and intuitive game.
accomplishments: Rewrote get_valid_moves() to use DFS pathfinding allowing orthogonal movement with direction changes
Modified backend API endpoints to work with destination-based moves instead of path-based
Implemented 5 themes (Cyberpunk, Classic Board, Neon Nights, Minimalist, Retro Arcade) with localStorage persistence
Fixed UI layout to fit on one screen
insights: Allowing direction changes during movement makes the game significantly more strategic
DFS pathfinding is computationally manageable for 4x4 board with max 4 moves
Simple click-to-destination UI is more intuitive than path building
Theme system adds nice personalization without complexity
learning: Learned game rules documentation (movement allows turns)
Discovered DFS with backtracking is perfect for small board pathfinding
challenges: Major misconception about the Collapsi game rules regarding movement restrictions
future_work: Test game engine thoroughly with edge cases
